name: Marc Olano
content: Marc Olano Marc Olano Computer Science and Electrical Engineering, ITE 354 University of Maryland, Baltimore County Baltimore, MD 21250 +1-410-455-3094 olano@umbc.edu Associate Dean of Academic Programs and Learning, College of Engineering and Information Technology Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science and Electrical Engineering Affiliate Associate Professor, Imaging Research Center Director, Computer Science Game Development Track Co-director, VANGOGH lab (full calendar) Major accomplishments: Pioneered procedural shading on graphics hardware, now a standard feature on every PC and game platform. This is one of the defining features of graphics hardware today. Developed a homogeneous (clipless) rendering technique used in many generations of PC graphics processors. Did some of the key work on using normal maps on low-detail 3D models (including coming up with the name), now a common technique in games. Developed automatic shader program simplification. I did it to allow more complex hardware shaders, but has lead to work by Pixar and Industrial Light and Magic for interactive previews of movie production shaders. CV Resources For more information on UMBC's programs on Games, Animation and Interactive Media (including game development track requirements), see the GAIM page.
